The instructions explicitly forbid such ambiguity and emotional language. Furthermore, the description focuses heavily on static elements—the beached boats, the shelter, the sandbanks—rather than prioritizing the motion itself. In the imagined video, the primary and only action is the camera's movement, which creates a parallax effect, revealing the landscape chronologically. A better caption would focus entirely on this action, describing how the camera's path first frames the vast water and sky, then sweeps across to unveil the islands and sandbanks, and finally brings the foreground shore with its stationary boats into view. The description of the static boats and landscape should be presented as a consequence of the camera's movement, not as the main subject of the paragraph.
